be788c42-a13f-4571-8bed-d7d06e25be41.description: Smurfit Kappa partnered with INSEAD, one of the world’s leading business schools, to design a fully customised leadership development programme based on the Smurfit Kappa Open Leadership model. The programme is based the premise that business performance is linked to human behaviour. Over 24 months the programme gives participants an opportunity to develop more breadth and depth to the way that they lead in Smurfit Kappa.
be788c42-a13f-4571-8bed-d7d06e25be41.name: Smurfit Kappa Open Leadership Programme

badge_template_activities.title: Participants participate in a three module programme over 24 months. Each module is of 4-5 days duration, during which they engage in a variety of learning activities including case studies, small group work, experiential action-learning workshop, simulations, One to one coaching, personal reflection and reading, small coaching groups and structured feedback processes involving self, peers and professional coaches.

skills.name: Open up and make the most of diversity

ce68be21-a231-436b-8e7f-6a0698e81a8f.description: AMD is the Smurfit Kappa Academy's Flagship Talent Acceleration programme. It is designed to equip high potential managers with the skills they need to lead the organisation into the future. Participants learn from subject matter experts from around the group to gain an indepth understanding of the Smurfit Kappa business, and engage in Masterclasses with external experts to develop their skills and capability.
ce68be21-a231-436b-8e7f-6a0698e81a8f.name: Advanced Management Development (AMD)

badge_template_activities.title: The 5 week programme takes place in three parts, spread across 9 months. Participants attend instructor led modules (virtual or in person) during all parts of the programme.

In small multidisciplinary groups, participants spend 8 months working on a global strategic project designed to increase their knowledge of the business, improve their ability to navigate our global organisational structure and work together collaboratively with their team and others to find an innovative solution to the identified issue. At the programme finale the groups present their ideas to the Group Executive Committee, including the Group CEO.

skills.name: Acquiring Knowledge About Health And Safety And Organising
Aligned Sales And Marketing Strategy With Business Priorities
Understanding Self And Others Through Personality

c85097bd-9922-4103-be7f-0dfa8e429b7c.description: GMP is designed to support the successful on-boarding and development of our management community. Participants are newly appointed General or Mill Managers and equivalent support function managers who have been promoted, externally hired or joined through a newly acquired business. The programme comprises a varied schedule to ensure that these managers are equipped with the tools and information that they need to be successful managers at Smurfit Kappa.
c85097bd-9922-4103-be7f-0dfa8e429b7c.name: Smurfit Kappa Global Manager Programme

badge_template_activities.title: This blended two-module programme takes place virtually and in our Global Experience Centre in Amsterdam. There is pre-programme work to complete in the form of 360-degree feedback and using the Myers Briggs Type Indicator tool with coaching sessions between modules. Each module is designed to have a mix of classroom and practical sessions covering topics related to management development, finance, sales, operational excellence, health and safety.

ca2b6e43-fd02-4f9c-b055-a35606d590af.description: Smurfit Kappa Rise is a development programme, designed to uniquely support the development Smurfit Kappa female employees. Participants learn from external experts, SK Leaders and each other to develop skills, enhance their belief in their own abilities and build a network from across the organisation.
ca2b6e43-fd02-4f9c-b055-a35606d590af.name: Smurfit Kappa Rise

badge_template_activities.title: The programme, delivered virtually by our learning partner, the Irish Management Institute (IMI) is made up of three modules, each with 4 component parts; a learning module focusing on key learnings for female professionals, a leader spotlight where a SK leader shares their experience of the module topic, a peer coaching session where group participants support each other in small groups to work through their challenges and a one-to-one mentoring session with a business leader.

46e000e6-181d-4587-8fba-9e85836aa7ca.description: The Lean Advanced training of the Smurfit Kappa Business Excellence Academy teaches participants how to ‘think lean’ about business processes to reduce waste, cut costs and increase customer value. With this training participants learn how to apply lean methodologies, tools and techniques to support continuous improvement and to manage change.
46e000e6-181d-4587-8fba-9e85836aa7ca.name: Smurfit Kappa Lean Advanced

badge_template_activities.title: The Lean Advanced Training is one week session during which participants attend instructor led modules in person. Participants will be trained on an overview of and introduction to lean, understanding the Voice of the Customer, the ‘8 Deadly Wastes’, Daily Management and Pulse meetings, Simple Problem Solving, Value Stream Mapping, 5S, Visual management, Standard work and Kamishibai in a challenging interactive team environment.

Participants will need to actively participate in and complete the one-week Lean Advanced Training of Smurfit Kappa’s Business Excellence Academy. The participants must have commitment from their manager for them to participate in the training.
To verify if participants have well understood the content of the training, they will need to pass the Lean Advanced Examination.

ad582553-da46-4da3-b06c-1686f8bcd3ef.description: Smurfit Kappa partnered with INSEAD, one of the world’s leading business schools, to design a fully customised leadership development programme based on the Smurfit Kappa Open Leadership model. The programme is based the premise that business performance is linked to human behaviour. This programme was designed for our senior leaders to support their own development and to equip them with the knowledge and language to support those leaders participating from their business.
ad582553-da46-4da3-b06c-1686f8bcd3ef.name: Smurfit Kappa Open Leadership CEO Programme

badge_template_activities.title: Participants participated in a 2 x 5-6 day modules over 18 months, engaging in a variety of learning activities including case studies, small group work, experiential action-learning workshop, simulations, one to one coaching, personal reflection and reading, small coaching groups and structured feedback processes involving self, peers and professional coaches.

skills.name: Open up and make the most of diversity
